result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberto Carlos Hernandez Valencia Jr.

records.addlTxt:
1:34 PM Defendant Roberto Carlos Hernandez Valencia Jr. in court.  Attorney Imani Hollie in court for Roberto Carlos Hernandez Valencia Jr.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions where matter is at.  Atty Viel requests another date for plea/sentencing to give defendant time to finish conditions.  Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

10:20 AM Defendant Roberto Carlos Hernandez Valencia Jr. in court.  Attorney Imani Hollie in court for Roberto Carlos Hernandez Valencia Jr.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 21, 2022 at 11:45 am.

1:04 PM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Roberto Carlos Hernandez Valencia Jr. appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Shannon Viel appeared by video for Roberto Carlos Hernandez Valencia Jr.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Atty Viel requests balance of IA be set as SPD will be appointing counsel to represent defendant.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
